articles.title: Mongolian delegation visits Kumsusan Memorial Palace
Koreans in china favor reunification platform
articles.content:
Mongolian delegation visits Kumsusan Memorial Palace 
 Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Mongolian social-democratic party led by its General Secretary L. Byambajargal visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on August 27.
    After expressing reverences before the Statue of the President Kim Il Sung, they made bows to the President, who lies in state.
   They looked round a train car used by the President for his on-site guidance and foreign trip, and a car he used in the last days of his life.
   The General Secretary wrote in the visitor's book  "The idea and cause of his excellency Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the fraternal Korean people, will be immortal".

articles.title: Ceaseless war manoeuvres against north
articles.content:
Koreans in china favor reunification platform
 Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- Yang Yong Dong, Chairman of the Federation of Korean Nationals in China (FKNC), released a statement on Monday supporting Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
   He said that in the work Secretary Kim Jong Il explained the three charters of national reunification.
   As Secretary Kim Jong Il said, the south Korean authorities must give up dependence on outsiders and "cooperation" with them, make a switchover in policy and take an independent stand benefitting the nation and depending on it, yang said.
   He urged the united states to renounce the anachronistic policy towards Korea and stop obstructing Korea's independent and peaceful reunification.
   The FKNC and Koreans in china will conduct vigorous activities to smash the moves of the separatists and promote Korean reunification, thus acclaiming Secretary Kim Jong Il at a square hailing the reunification, he declared.

articles.title: Secy. Kim Jong Il's idea on reunification supported by youth league
articles.content:
Ceaseless war manoeuvres against north
 Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet clique continued large-scale war manoeuvres against the north within the framework of the provocative "Ulji Focus Lens" military drill, according to a radio report from Seoul.
   The puppet clique drove out the second fleet of the navy on August 26 for a "Drill for mobilizing civilian ships in wartime".
   The fleet is intensifying military exercises under the wartime condition including a "drill for emergency support to ship ammunitions" and a "drill for linking emergency telecommunication lines" during the "Ulji Focus Lens" war exercises.
   On the same day, the "Ulji" unit of the army staged a chemical training and another unit fired blank shells and smock-screen shells in Koyang, Kyonggi Province.
   The south Korea-U.S. "combined forces command" on August 22 opened to the public the high-altitude strategic reconnaissance plane U-2 belonging to the U.S. troops present in south Korea.

articles.title: Press review
articles.content:
Secy. Kim Jong Il's idea on reunification supported by youth league
 Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, First Secretary of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, published a statement Wednesday hailing Secretary Kim Jong Il's celebrated work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Rreunification".
   In the statement he expressed full support for the work, saying it is the torchlight of patriotism and the reunification programme common to the nation which encourages the Korean people's reunification movement in a new historic era.
   The youth league officials and youths and students, he said, will take as their lifelong maxim President Kim Il Sung's instructions for reunification and Secretary Kim Jong Il's idea on reunification movement.
   They, as the first death-defying squad and as the young vanguard of the General, will devotedly carry into practice his reunification idea and policies whatever difficulties and circumstances may come, he declared.
   He expressed the belief that the Federation of University Students councils and patriotic students in south Korea will wage a more vigorous struggle for independence, democracy of society and national reunification, cherishing their historic mission for building a reunified country.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun calls for glorifying tradition of youth movement
articles.content:
Press review
Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- Today is the 70th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's foundation of the Young Communist League of Korea and the 6th Youth Day.
   On this occasion Rodong Sinmun editorially calls for exalting the glorious tradition of the youth movement of Juche under the leadership of the party.
   Given in papers is an account of a national meeting held to mark the 70th anniversary of the YCLK. edited in the press are articles on the young people growing staunch as the successors to and main forces of the revolution.
   Rodong Sinmun carries an article headlined "future of Korean youth movement will shine forever, led by peerlessly great men", illustrated by a picture of President Kim Il Sung and Secretary Kim Jong Il planting trees together with youth and children in April 1991.
   Minju Joson comes out with a commentary hailing the step taken by a joint meeting which discussed the measure to implement the tasks indicated by Secretary Kim Jong Il in his work dated August 4. 
   Rodong Sinmun conveys news about innovation effected in the coal industry sector.
   It is reported in the press that delegates of non-governmental organisations in their speeches at the 49th session of the U.N. sub-commission on prevention of discrimination and protection of minorities demanded the Japanese Government make a state compensation to "Comfort Women for the Army".
   Papers carry articles on miserable plight of youth and children in countries where capitalism was restored.

articles.title: Young communist league of Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun calls for glorifying tradition of youth movement
 Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Young Communist League of Korea by President Kim Il Sung and the 6th anniversary of the Youth Day.
   Rodong Sinmun today comes out with an editorial marking these anniversaries.
   The editorial extends greatest glory to President Kim Il Sung and Secretary Kim Jong Il for ushering in a new phase of the youth movement in the era of independence and successfully bringing up the young Korean people to be dependable heirs to the Juche revolutionary cause and reliable undertakers of the building of the prospering country. It also extends congratulations to all the young men and women across the country.
   The editorial further says:
   The President opened up a new phase of the Juche-oriented youth movement, newly indicated the position and role of the young people in the fulfilment of the revolutionary cause and started the great history of attaching importance to the youth.
   The glorious and triumphant course covered by the Korean youth movement is adorned with the energetic guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea which has faithfully carried out the President's idea of attaching importance to the youth.
   It is none other than Secretary Kim Jong Il who set forth the revolutionary slogan, "love the youth !." And inspired the young people with strength and courage so that they can bring their ideal and purpose into full bloom. It is also the General who advanced unique idea and theory on the youth movement and brought about a new change in the work with the youth by implementing them to the letter.
   All the victories and achievements made in the development of the Korean youth movement and the high honor and happiness enjoyed by the young Korean people are ascribable to the wise guidance of the General.
   Their noble traits and qualifications are characterised by intense loyalty to the party and the leader, devoted service to the country and the people, noble morality and obligation to the revolutionary forerunners, strong organisation and discipline, diligence and simplicity. With these traits and qualifications, they are unswervingly advancing along the road of socialism without any slightest vacillation under the guidance of the party.
   The editorial calls upon all the young Korean men and women to resolutely defend and exalt the tradition of the Juche-based youth movement associated with the undying exploits of the great party and the leader and thus accomplish the cause of socialism and reunify the country under any circumstances.

articles.title: Timely step
articles.content:
Young communist league of Korea 
Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- Today is the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Young Communist League of Korea (YCLK).
   Celebration meetings, symposiums, art, sports and other colorful events have been held in Korea to significantly greet this anniversary.
   It was founded by President Kim Il Sung on August 28, 1927.
   It was not only a vanguard detachment of young Korean communists but also a secret vanguard organisation to direct mass organisations involving people from all walks of life.
   It made an undying contribution to bringing up hardcore elements of the new-generation communists and building up revolutionary forces of Juche.
   The young communists expanded and consolidated the mass foundation of the revolution by dynamically conducting art and revolutionary activities in the rural areas for mass political operation and mass enlightenment.
   It upheld the President as the lodestar of the Korean revolution and as the centre of unity and leadership.
   Its members renamed him after the sun and composed the immortal revolutionary song "Star of Korea". 
   It played a pivotal role in accomplishing the historic cause of forming a new-type revolutionary party organisation and the anti-Japanese people's guerrilla army in Korea.
   In the days of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, the YCLK members creditably carried out the Juche-based line and strategical and tactical policies of the Korean revolution not only as valiant combatants and able commanders of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army but Also as tested political operatives and underground organisation members. In the course of this, they highly displayed the indomitable patriotic stamina and heroic spirit of the Korean youth.
   After the country was liberated, the YCLK was strengthened into the democratic youth league, a mass youth organisation, on the basis of the valuable tradition of the youth movement created during the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle. In keeping with the development of the socialist construction, it was renamed the League of Socialist Working Youth of Korea and then the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.

articles.title: Talks between delegations of WPK and MSDP
articles.content:
Timely step 
Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson in a commentary today views the step taken at the joint meeting of the Reunification Policy Committee of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland and the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of the Fatherland as a timely and important one marking an epochal occasion in expanding and strengthening the reunification movement on a nationwide scale.
   The meeting discussed the measure to implement the tasks set forth in Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
   The daily says:
   The work indicates the fundamental principles which the Korean nation should observe, and the political programme which should be taken as a guideline in building up the driving force of national reunification, and unfolds a blueprint for establishing a reunified state.
   It is the unanimous will of the Korean people to solve the reunification question in keeping with the demand of the nation for independence and its interests, according to the three charters for national reunification, remaining loyal to the leadership of Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   Fully reflected in the step of the meeting are the unanimous will and desire of the Korean people.
   Obstacles and difficulties are still standing in the way of national reunification but the cause of reunification will be certainly achieved as long as there are the most reasonable and realistic reunification programme provided by President Kim Il Sung, the great leadership for realizing the reunification and the unshakable will of the Korean nation to achieve the reunification of the country without fail.

articles.title: Mt. Paektu area, international biosphere reserve
articles.content:
Talks between delegations of WPK and MSDP
Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- Talks were held here on Thursday between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Mongolian social-democratic party.
   At the talks the two sides informed each other of the activities of their parties and exchanged views on developing the friendly relations between the two parties and on matters of mutual concern.
   Present at the talks on the Korean side were Choe Thae Bok, alternate politburo member and Secretary of the WPK Central Committee, Choe Jin Su, Vice-Director of a Department of the WPK Central Committee, and officials concerned and on the opposite side were the members of the MSDP delegation led by its General Secretary L. Byambajargal and Mongolian Ambassador to Korea D. Byambaa.

articles.title: NDFSK vows to carry out instructions for reunification
articles.content:
Mt. Paektu area, international biosphere reserve 
 Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- A drive is brisk in Korea to protect forests in the area of Mt. Paektu. It is part of joint activities between the Forest Protection Institute of Korea and the UNESCO.
   Ri Ki Jun, Scientific Vice-President of the Branch Academy of Forest Science under the National Academy of Sciences of the DPRK, said that forests of the area are drawing interest of academic circles for their vast scope and diversified plants and distinguished natural scenery and the area is a zone of great value in education of ecological system.
   Its area was registered as the international biosphere reserve at a meeting of the Bureau of the Mab International Coordinating Council under the UNESCO in April 1989.
   The zone was designated in order to conserve and place under international concern the history of formation of Mt. Paektu, its natural and geographical scenery, fauna and flora, cultural relics and remains and revolutionary sites and make scientific research into them.
   Now, the NESCO is striving to render support to the research and conservancy of the area.
   As part of this, it is substantially carrying on the work to conserve the forests and plants in the Mt. Paektu international biosphere reserve in a planned way. 
   In the meantime, scientists are engaged in their research work with the help of the local inhabitants.

articles.title: DPRK's withdrawal from "international convention" is legitimate step
articles.content:
NDFSK vows to carry out instructions for reunification
 Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- Hong Ji Yong, Vice-Chairman of the C.C., the National Democratic Front of South Korea (NDFSK), made public a statement Wednesday as regards Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification", it was reported by Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation.
   The statement said this library of national reunification published by Secretary  Kim Jong Il enables the entire fellow countrymen including the people in the south to accelerate the reunification movement with clearer goal and orientation.
   It further said:
  The south Korean rulers should, though belatedly, turn to national independence, reconciliation and unity, renouncing the policy of dependence on outsiders and the north-south confrontation policy. And they should abrogate the "National Security Law", the biggest obstacle to national reunification, and stop the repression of pro-reunification patriots at once.
   The United States, Japan and other countries concerned should not instigate the south Korean rulers to confrontation between the fellow countrymen and fascist suppression, clearly seeing the Korean people's will for national independence and reunification.
   The NDFSK will make a general march to win the great unity of the whole nation on the principle of national independence and achieve the reunification of the country based on a confederacy formula, upholding the great reunification programme set forth in the celebrated work.

articles.title: Kim Yong Sun meets Japanese guests
articles.content:
DPRK's withdrawal from "international convention" is legitimate step
 Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- The United States, France and other western countries adopted an anti-DPRK "resolution on human rights" in defiance of the DPRK's strong opposition at the 49th meeting of the United Nations sub-commission on human rights now being held in Geneva, according to a news report.
   The "resolution" urges the DPRK to respect the international human rights standards and immediately submit a report on the implementation of the "international convention" on citizens' political rights and also recommends the international community to pay deeper attention to the DPRK's situation of human rights.
   The unreasonable "resolution", which came when the United States and the south Korean puppets were escalating military threat to the DPRK, shows that the dishonest forces' anti-DPRK plots have reached a very dangerous stage.
   It is an unbearable violation of the DPRK's dignity and rights to independence and an intolerable challenge and interference in its internal affairs.
   In this regard, the DPRK Foreign Minister sent a letter the UN Secretary-General notifying him that the DPRK Government decided to withdraw from the "international convention" on August 23. The withdrawal is a just, self-defensive step over which nobody can slander the DPRK.
   It is only too natural that the DPRK, which regards independence as its life and soul, withdrew from the "international convention", which has reduced to a tool serving the dishonest forces in putting political pressure on independent nations, far from its mission of ensuring human rights of all countries. The withdrawal enables the DPRK to ensure human rights more satisfactorily in the country, not bound by the international legal requirements and formalities concerning the activities under the "convention".
   We have provided our people with genuine freedom and rights on a level far higher than the requirements of the "international convention". Doing so is the basic principles of activities maintained by our socialist system, which values man more than any other things.
   In this point of view, the "resolution" reveals the persistent anti-socialist, anti-DPRK campaign by the western imperialists. But, foolish is their attempt to block the advance of the DPRK with such a "resolution". 
   Their campaign only vindicates the validity of socialism and harden our people's will to defend their socialism.
   No matter how others may raise outcries over the withdrawal from the "international convention", we will continue going our own way, smashing the dishonest forces' anti-DPRK moves.
   We warn that if the dishonest forces continue hurting our sovereignty by abusing other "conventions" under the pretext of human rights, we will also withdraw from them.

articles.title: National meeting marks anniversary of YCLK
articles.content:
Kim Yong Sun meets Japanese guests
Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- Chairman of the Korean Asia-Pacific Peace Committee Kim Yong Sun, who is also Secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee, met and had a friendly talk with the Japan-Korea friendship delegation led by Shizuo Wada, Former Vice-Chairman of the social-democratic party of Japan, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
   Present there was Song Ho Gyong, Chairman of the Korea-Japan Friendship Association.
